adjectives.description: indisposed (comparative more indisposed, superlative most indisposed)

examples: He was indisposed with a cold.

entries.meaning: Not disposed, predisposed, or inclined; unwilling.
examples: I stayed indoors all day, feeling indisposed to finish mowing the lawn.

definitionGroups.group: Not yet ready (especially with regard to receiving a visitor) because not yet arranged into a state of readiness (i.e., not disposed); (especially, more specifically):

entries.meaning: (euphemistic) Undressed; not yet dressed enough to be seen by visitors.
